含义: The character '民' (mín) primarily means 'people' or 'citizens'. It refers to the common people, the populace, or the masses. It is often used in contexts related to society, governance, and the general public.
字形: The character '民' consists of 5 strokes. It is a pictographic character that originally depicted an eye with a line below it, symbolizing the common people who were often subjugated or watched over by rulers.
读音: The pronunciation of '民' is 'mín' in Mandarin Chinese, with the second tone (rising tone).
字源: The character '民' has its origins in ancient Chinese pictographs. It originally represented the concept of the common people, often depicted as an eye with a line below it, symbolizing the masses under the watchful eye of rulers.
含此字的字: 泯 (mǐn) - to vanish, to die out
岷 (mín) - name of a mountain range
常用词组: 民族 (mín zú) - ethnic group, nationality
民间 (mín jiān) - folk, among the people
成语: 民不聊生 (mín bù liáo shēng) - The people have no means of livelihood.
民以食为天 (mín yǐ shí wéi tiān) - Food is the first necessity of the people.
民富国强 (mín fù guó qiáng) - The people are wealthy and the country is strong.
民怨沸腾 (mín yuàn fèi téng) - Popular grievances are boiling over.
例句: 人民是国家的基础。 (Rén mín shì guó jiā de jī chǔ.) - The people are the foundation of the nation.
民生问题是政府关注的重点。 (Mín shēng wèn tí shì zhèng fǔ guān zhù de zhòng diǎn.) - Livelihood issues are a key focus of the government.
短故事: In ancient China, the character '民' was often used to refer to the common people who were the backbone of society. One famous story is about the philosopher Mencius, who emphasized the importance of the people in governance. He believed that a ruler who neglects the welfare of the people would lose the Mandate of Heaven.

Another story is about the Tang Dynasty poet Du Fu, who wrote extensively about the struggles of the common people. His poem 'The Ballad of the Army Carts' vividly describes the hardships faced by the '民' during wartime.
